item.title: GDELT, Missiles, and Image Collection
item.description: The Global Database of Events, Language, and Tone, or GDELT, is “a realtime network diagram and database of global human society for open research”. The potential for a firehose stream of global data has tantalizing possibilities for research, but concrete examples of work beyond simple evaluations of the database’s capabilities are notably absent… See: Foreign Policy’s 2013 article How Well Does GDELT Follow Events in Syria?
